section.title: Log in and log out of the Web SSO GUI
section.p: To log into the Web SSO GUI as an administrator, open the web browser and enter https:// <smhostserver>:8666/auth/ in the address bar. Then, enter the username and password to access the Web SSO server GUI.
section.note: The above mentioned username and password credentials are stored in system parameters, so they need to be in sync if SM login is to interact correctly with the WebSSO server. The following command can be used to view and change the credentials used by SM to communicate with the WebSSO server:TPA_systemProp | grep CKEY CKEY Admin User CKEY Admin Password
Generally, an SM user who is not an administrator only needs to log in to the SM as usual and the SM redirects the user as required.
section.p:
Once a user logs into the Web SSO server GUI, the Launch Pad is displayed that provides various options. The desired category under which all the entities belonging to that particular category are available may be selected. Categories available on the Web SSO server GUI
Category Description
Administration Console Allows the admin to centrally manage all aspects of the Web SSO server by redirecting to the Admin Console of the Web SSO server.
Documentation Allows the admin to access the documentation related to Web SSO server information, such as server installation and configuration guide, server administration guide, and Javadocs amongst many others.
Keycloak Project Allows the admin to learn Web SSO server basics, such as adding authentication to Web SSO server applications and securing services.
Mailing List Allows the admin to manage or subscribe to the Web SSO user mailing list.
Report an issue Allows the admin to resolve any known Web SSO server issues by redirecting to the known issues list and their related workarounds.
